item.title: HMPV outbreak: Common symptoms seen in kids and adults - The Times of India
item.description:
HMPV outbreak: Common symptoms seen in kids and adults

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

The Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) outbreak is raising global concerns regarding its transmission and symptoms.

  • HMPV is being monitored closely in China and other countries.
  • It is prevalent among children aged 14 and under, especially in hospital visits.
  • Common symptoms include cough, fever, nasal congestion, and shortness of breath.
  • Severe cases can lead to bronchitis and pneumonia.
  • HMPV spreads through respiratory droplets from infected individuals.
  • Good hygiene practices are essential for prevention.
  • HMPV is responsible for about 20,000 hospitalizations among children under 5 in the U.S. annually.
“Currently, there is no vaccine against HMPV.”

In conclusion, staying informed and practicing hygiene precautions can help mitigate the spread of HMPV.

item.title: IND vs AUS 5th Test Live Score: Cummins ends Rishabh Pant's sparkling thrill-a-minute knock; India 5 down - India TV News
item.description:
IND vs AUS 5th Test Live Score: India's lead reaches 145 after Pant blitz but suspense over Bumrah continues

Date: January 4, 2025 | Source: India TV News

On the second day of the 5th Test, India has established a 145-run lead following a stellar performance by Rishabh Pant, despite concerns over Jasprit Bumrah's fitness. India needs to capitalize on their lead to secure a critical victory in the series.

  • India was bowled out for 185, with Rishabh Pant scoring a quick 61 runs off 33 balls.
  • Scott Boland took several wickets, continuing to apply pressure on the Indian batting lineup.
  • Jasprit Bumrah has left the field due to possible injury, causing concerns for the Indian bowling attack.
  • Australia trails by 84 runs with five wickets in hand as they respond to India's first innings score.
  • Rohit Sharma opted to sit out this Test, stating he needed to improve his batting form.
“This decision is not a retirement call, neither I'm stepping away. But I sat out of this game because I have not been scoring runs.” - Rohit Sharma

India must maintain their focus and capitalize on their lead, especially with Bumrah's uncertain status impacting their strategy for the remainder of the match.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah returns to Sydney Cricket Ground after hospital visit - The Times of India
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Returns to Sydney Cricket Ground After Hospital Visit

Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

India's stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah made a concerning exit from the SCG during the final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy but has since returned after a visit to the hospital.

  • Bumrah left the field with the team doctor after bowling just one over post-Lunch.
  • He previously took the important wicket of Marnus Labuschagne, bringing his series total to 32 wickets.
  • The record, set on Australian soil, surpasses the previous record of 31 wickets held by Bishan Singh Bedi.
  • Bumrah's timely return is crucial as he has been pivotal to the team's performance this series.
Throughout his spell, Bumrah maintained decent speeds and consistently clocked over 135 kmph with no visible discomfort.

Team India hopes that Bumrah's minor issue is not serious, as his availability is essential for the remainder of the match.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 5th Test Day 2: Jasprit Bumrah is back in the Indian dressing room, IND 97/4 vs AUS in Sydney - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 5th Test Day 2

Publication Date: Saturday
Source: Indian Express

On Day 2 of the 5th Test in Sydney, India is in a challenging position with 124 runs for 5 wickets, while Australia had taken a slight lead of 181 runs at Tea. Notable performances include Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna taking three wickets each, and Jasprit Bumrah’s hospital visit after a bowling incident.

  • India scored 185 in their first innings.
  • Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna took three wickets each to restrict Australia.
  • Jasprit Bumrah sent to the hospital for scans after his bowling outing.
  • Rishabh Pant has departed during the ongoing match.
  • Match is live at the Sydney Cricket Ground.
“India could not put on a better top-order display despite replacing their out-of-form skipper Rohit Sharma.”

As the match progresses, Australia's steadiness with a lead suggests a riveting contest ahead as India needs to regroup to stay competitive.

item.title: 500 On Bumble, 200 On Snapchat: Delhi Man Scams 700 Women As "US Model" - NDTV
item.description:
Delhi Man Scams Over 700 Women by Posing as US Model on Dating Apps

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Not Specified

An East Delhi man was arrested for defrauding over 700 women by posing as a US-based model on dating apps, using manipulation and blackmail for financial gain.

Key Points:

  • Tushar Singh Bisht, 23, worked as a recruiter in Noida while engaging in cybercrime at night.
  • Created fake profiles on dating apps using stolen photos of a Brazilian model.
  • Targeted primarily women aged 18-30, extorting money with manipulated intimate content.
  • Victims were threatened with the release of personal content if they refused to pay.
  • Police investigations revealed over 500 women contacted on Bumble and more than 200 on Snapchat.
  • Recovered mobile phone and incriminating evidence during the arrest.
  • At least four victims have been identified in addition to the initial complainant.
“If a victim refused his demands for money, he would threaten to upload their explicit content online or sell it on the dark web.”

The investigation highlights the growing danger of online impersonation and the need for awareness regarding online interactions and privacy.

item.title: iPhone 16 Plus now available for only Rs 39,750, here's how to avail this offer - India TV News
item.description:
Massive Discount on iPhone 16 Plus: Now Available for Rs 39,750

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: India TV News

The new year has brought excellent discounts on smartphones, particularly on the iPhone 16 series. The iPhone 16 Plus is now available for Rs 39,750 through various offers and discounts.

  • The iPhone 16 Plus has a listed price of Rs 89,900 but has dropped to Rs 84,900 due to a 5% discount.
  • Add an instant discount of Rs 4,000 with specific credit card payments, reducing the price further to Rs 80,900.
  • By trading in an old smartphone, customers can receive an additional exchange value of Rs 41,150.
  • Overall, with all offers applied, the iPhone 16 Plus can be purchased for just Rs 39,750.
  • The smartphone features a 6.7-inch Super AMOLED display, IP68 certification, and runs on iOS 18.
  • It is powered by the Apple A18 Bionic chipset and offers up to 8GB RAM and 512GB storage.
“If you make the most of these offers, you could walk away with the iPhone 16 Plus for just Rs 39,750.”

In conclusion, this is a great opportunity for customers looking to invest in an iPhone this new year.

item.title: Govinda’s wife Sunita Ahuja implies they live separately, isn’t sure if he’s cheating on her: ‘Khali baitha hai kuch kar na daale’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Govinda’s Wife Sunita Ahuja Discusses Their Marriage and Rumors

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Indian Express

Sunita Ahuja recently opened up about her marriage to Govinda, highlighting their separate living arrangements and raising suspicions about his fidelity.

  • Sunita revealed they live in separate houses, with Govinda often spending time at his bungalow.
  • She mentioned that their relationship initiated by her, and reflected on Govinda's lack of romantic gestures.
  • After 37 years of marriage, Sunita expressed her worries regarding Govinda's potential affairs as he grows older.
  • Despite past affairs rumors during his peak career, Sunita is more cautious now that he is over 60.
“Khaali baitha hai kuch kar na daale” (he is sitting idle, what if he does something).

Although they have shared their lives together, Sunita's apprehensions about their future together illustrate the complexities of their long-term marriage.

item.title: Who was Kareem Badawi? University of Alabama student killed in New Orleans terror attack - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kareem Badawi: University of Alabama Student Killed in New Orleans Terror Attack

Date: Jan 04, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Kareem Badawi, an 18-year-old freshman at the University of Alabama, tragically died in a terrorist attack in New Orleans on New Year’s Eve. His passing has left the Episcopal School community in Baton Rouge mourning the loss of an exceptional young man.

  • Kareem graduated from Episcopal High School and was a beloved member of the football team.
  • He was known for his kindness and strong work ethic, achieving a 4.0 GPA in his first semester of college.
  • He was in New Orleans to reunite with friends when he was killed in the attack.
  • Another former classmate, Parker Vidrine, was injured and remains in ICU.
  • Friends honored him by getting tattoos that read “KB 1-1-2025.”
  • A memorial was held at the Episcopal School chapel, which overflowed with attendees.
“Why innocent people have to suffer, especially a guy like Kareem, who was well-liked, not a hurtful bone in his body. He's a very kind, gentle guy.” - Travis Bourgeois, Kareem’s former football coach

The community's heartbreak following Kareem's death highlights the impact he had on those around him.

item.title: 7 Latest Space Pictures From NASA Hubble Space Telescope - Times Now
item.description:
7 Latest Space Pictures From NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: Jan 4, 2025 Source: Times Now

The article showcases the most recent breathtaking images taken by the Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting stunning celestial events and formations.

  • AFGL 5180: A star-forming region in the Gemini constellation, offering insights into the birth of solar systems.
  • Arp-Madore 2339-661: An image of an interacting galaxy pair, revealing hidden complexities of celestial interactions.
  • Galaxy IC 3225: A spiral galaxy with a distinct shape, resembling a comet shot from a cannon.
  • From Dim To Dazzling: Capturing vibrant star formation in IRAS 16562-3959 located 5900 light-years away.
  • The Little Dumbbell Nebula: A stunning nebula featured for the 34th anniversary of the Hubble telescope.
  • A Spiral Star Factory: Showcasing the spiral galaxy NGC 5668, a popular target for astronomers.
  • Stellar Ensemble In NGC 6357: Highlights the star cluster Pismis 24 within a vast nebula.
“Hubble’s colorful capture of star formation in IRAS 16562-3959. This week’s Hubble image bursts with color and energy.”

The article emphasizes the ongoing significance of Hubble’s contributions to astronomy and our understanding of the universe.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 5th Test Day 2: AUS 181 all out vs IND at Sydney - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 5th Test Day 2: Updates from Sydney

Date & Source: January 2025, Indian Express

On Day 2 of the 5th Test in Sydney, Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna excelled with the ball, taking three wickets each to restrict Australia to 181 runs at Tea, giving India a lead in the first innings.

  • Australia scored 181 runs by Tea on Day 2.
  • India had a total score of 185 runs in their first innings.
  • Jasprit Bumrah picked up two wickets, but was taken to the hospital for scans.
  • Beau Webster scored 50 runs for Australia.
  • The match faced off-field tensions due to Rohit Sharma's omission from the squad.
“Selectors told Rohit Sharma they were looking beyond him after BGT.”

The match continues with India leading by 52 runs, showcasing an interesting contest as both teams aim to gain the upper hand in this critical Test.

item.title: RBI grants approval to HDFC Bank to acquire up to 9.50% stake in AU Small Finance Bank - CNBCTV18
item.description:
RBI Grants Approval to HDFC Bank to Acquire Up to 9.50% Stake in AU Small Finance Bank

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has granted approval for HDFC Bank to acquire up to 9.50% stake in AU Small Finance Bank, and also to acquire similar stakes in Kotak Mahindra Bank and Capital Small Finance Bank.

  • HDFC Bank must complete the acquisition within one year from the approval date to retain the approval.
  • The approval covers HDFC Bank and its group entities, including several subsidiaries.
  • HDFC Bank is also cleared to maintain aggregate holdings across specified banks without exceeding 9.50%.
“If the acquisition is not completed within this period, the approval will be cancelled,” said AU Small Finance Bank in an exchange filing.

This move signals strategic growth for HDFC Bank through expansions and partnerships within the Indian banking sector.

item.title: US surgeon Vivek Murthy says alcohol increases risk of 7 types of cancers; urges warning on labels | Mint - Mint
item.description:
US Surgeon General Urges Cancer Warnings on Alcohol Labels

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

U.S. Surgeon General Vivek Murthy has highlighted the link between alcohol consumption and the increased risk of at least seven types of cancer, calling for warning labels on alcoholic beverages.

  • Alcohol consumption increases the risk of breast, colon, and liver cancer, among others.
  • Surgeon General emphasizes that most consumers are unaware of these risks.
  • Alcohol is the third leading preventable cause of cancer in the U.S.
  • Currently, alcohol is responsible for 100,000 cancer cases and 20,000 cancer deaths annually.
  • Increased alcohol consumption leads to about five additional women and three more men developing cancer per 100.
"Alcohol consumption is the third leading preventable cause of cancer in the United States, after tobacco and obesity." - Vivek Murthy

The Surgeon General's advisory suggests that re-evaluating alcohol consumption guidelines could help individuals make informed decisions regarding drinking.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test Day 2: IND race ahead with Reddy double strike despite Bumrah injury - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test Day 2

Date: January 4, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

India has taken a narrow 4-run lead after Australia were all out for 181, despite a critical injury setback for Indian captain Jasprit Bumrah.

  • India leads by 4 runs after Australia all out for 181.
  • Nitish Kumar Reddy took Australia’s last two wickets in consecutive balls.
  • Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj both claimed three wickets each.
  • Beau Webster scored a half-century on his Test debut.
  • Bumrah left the field for medical scans after bowling just one over.
“Jasprit Bumrah was spotted leaving the SCG for scans; he left the field after bowling just one over.”

This match holds significant implications, with Australia seeking their first Border-Gavaskar Trophy win in over a decade and India aiming for a place in the World Test Championship finals.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Status: Is It Out Yet? Steps To Check Allotment Status Online, Check GMP - News18
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Status: Is It Out Yet? Steps To Check Allotment Status Online, Check GMP

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 14:39 IST

The allotment of Indo Farm Equipment IPO is highly anticipated, with a heavy subscription rate causing a delay in the finalization. The shares are expected to show a strong listing while the grey market price indicates a significant premium.

  • Indo Farm Equipment Ltd's IPO was heavily subscribed, receiving 227.67 times in total, with different subscription rates across categories.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) currently stands at 46.05%, suggesting a strong listing on January 7.
  • Investors can check their allotment status via the BSE and NSE websites or on Mas Services Ltd's portal.
  • The IPO consists of a fresh issue of 86 lakh equity shares and an Offer-for-Sale of 35 lakh equity shares.
“Status will be available on January 4, 2025” - Mas Services Ltd.

The IPO of Indo Farm Equipment Ltd, a company involved in manufacturing agricultural equipment, indicates strong investor interest and could lead to a significant market capitalisation upon listing.

item.title: India monitoring reports of HMPV spread in China, no cause for panic: Health ministry - The Times of India
item.description:
India Monitoring HMPV Spread in China: Health Ministry Assures No Panic Required

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

The Indian government is closely monitoring reports of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) detected in China but assures the public there is no cause for panic.

  • The Health Ministry stated it is aware of the rise in HMPV cases in China.
  • Health officials recommend vigilance and adherence to health protocols but see no immediate threat to India.
  • The ministry is in contact with health authorities globally for updates and guidance.
“At this moment, we do not foresee a crisis; our healthcare system is prepared to handle any potential cases.” - Health Ministry Spokesperson

The government will continue to monitor the situation and keep the public informed with timely updates.

item.title: Virat Kohli Leads India, Worrying Visuals Show Jasprit Bumrah Leaving For Hospital Due To... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Leaves Match for Hospital After Injury Scare

Date: January 4, 2025 | Source: NDTV

India faced a significant setback as pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah left the Sydney stadium for scans after experiencing discomfort during the fifth Test against Australia.

  • Bumrah felt discomfort after bowling one over post-lunch.
  • He has taken 32 wickets in the series so far, with figures of 2/33 in the current match.
  • Virat Kohli is leading the team in Bumrah's absence.
  • Bumrah left the field after consulting with Kohli and was seen leaving in a vehicle.
“Humare ladke jab tak shaant hain tab tak shaant hain. Agar aap ungli kar rahe ho, tab thodi na koi shaant baithega.” - Rohit Sharma

This incident raises concerns about Bumrah's injury and its potential impact on the Indian team's performance.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah leaves the Sydney Cricket Ground with team doctor - The Times of India
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Leaves Sydney Cricket Ground with Team Doctor

Date: Saturday
Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah left the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG) during a match against Australia after a short bowling spell. Initial reports suggest that he is being taken for scans although there is no official confirmation from the Indian team yet.

  • Bumrah took a total of 32 wickets in Australia, breaking the previous record held by Bishan Singh Bedi.
  • He bowled a four-over spell in the morning session and has been the key player for India in this series.
  • His quick departure after bowling just one over post-lunch raised concerns about his fitness.
“India would hope there is nothing serious because he has been their MVP this series.”

This incident raises questions about Bumrah's fitness as he has been crucial for India's performance, and his absence would be felt significantly.

item.title: PM Modi to inaugurate Grameen Bharat Mahotsav in Delhi - Newsroompost
item.description:
PM Modi to Inaugurate Grameen Bharat Mahotsav in Delhi

Date: Saturday
Source: New Delhi

Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate Grameen Bharat Mahotsav 2025 at Bharat Mandapam in Delhi, celebrating rural India's entrepreneurial spirit and cultural heritage.

  • The Mahotsav will occur from 4 to 9 January, themed 'Building a Resilient Rural India for a Viksit Bharat 2047.'
  • It aims to enhance rural infrastructure and foster innovation in rural communities through discussions, workshops, and masterclasses.
  • Objective includes promoting economic stability and financial security among rural populations, especially in North-East India.
  • A significant focus will be on empowering rural women through entrepreneurship and utilizing technology to enhance rural livelihoods.

Additionally, PM Modi recently inaugurated 1,675 newly constructed flats for JJ cluster dwellers and virtual redevelopment projects in Delhi.

“For every Rs 25 lakh spent on the construction of a flat, eligible beneficiaries pay less than 7 per cent of the total amount.”

The Mahotsav aims for collaborative rural transformation and will showcase India’s rich cultural heritage.

item.title: Closely monitoring influenza cases in India, no need to be alarmed: Govt on HMPV outbreak in China - The Indian Express
item.description:
Monitoring Influenza Cases: No Alarm Needed Over HMPV in China

Publication Date: January 2025   Source: Indian Express

The National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) is closely monitoring respiratory and seasonal influenza cases in India, amidst reports of an outbreak of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in China. Official sources have stated that there is no need for alarm.

  • NCDC is in touch with international agencies regarding the HMPV outbreak.
  • There is no substantial increase in respiratory outbreak data for December 2024 in India.
  • DGHS Dr. Atul Goel likened HMPV to common cold viruses.
  • Precautions advised include respiratory etiquette and avoiding contact if symptomatic.
“There is nothing to be alarmed about the present situation,” - Dr. Atul Goel

As winter increases the outbreak of respiratory infections, hospitals are prepared with necessary supplies and beds. General precautions for respiratory infections are recommended.

item.title: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan says 'chala chala' adorably in Marathi, wishes 'Happy New Year', Abhishek Bachchan - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Aishwarya Rai Bachchan says 'chala chala' adorably in Marathi, wishes 'Happy New Year', Abhishek Bachchan wins the internet as a protective husband, father - WATCH VIDEO

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

Abhishek and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan have addressed rumors about their marriage while celebrating the New Year with their daughter. The couple has shared a recent public appearance, dispelling the divorce rumors circulating about them.

  • The couple was not seen at a recent wedding, sparking speculation about their relationship.
  • They attended a wedding together and their daughter Aaradhya's school function to combat narratives of separation.
  • Returning from a New Year holiday, they engaged with photographers, with Aishwarya adorably saying 'Chala Chala' in Marathi.
  • Abhishek played a protective role, ensuring both Aishwarya and Aaradhya were safe as they entered their car.
  • Abhishek's recent work includes acclaimed performance in 'I Want To Talk' and upcoming roles in 'Housefull 5' and 'King'.
“Chala Chala” - Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, wishing the paparazzi a Happy New Year.

The couple seems unaffected by rumors, presenting a united front for their daughter and public, further cementing their family image.

item.title: US Surgeon-General Vivek Murthy wants cancer warning on alcohol: How does your drinking habit cause cancer? - The Indian Express
item.description:
US Surgeon-General Vivek Murthy Wants Cancer Warning on Alcohol

Date: Not mentioned in the article
Source: Indian Express

US Surgeon-General Vivek Murthy has called for alcoholic beverages to carry cancer warning labels, highlighting evidence that no level of alcohol consumption is safe when it comes to cancer risk.

  • Alcohol is the third leading preventable cause of cancer in the US, following tobacco and obesity.
  • Consumption of just one drink per day can increase the risk for several cancers including breast, mouth, and throat.
  • Alcohol is classified as a group 1 carcinogen by the WHO, with no safe level of consumption.
  • Dr Murthy's report states alcohol increases the risk of at least seven types of cancer.
  • Dr Murthy draws parallels with India's anti-smoking campaigns as a model for addressing alcohol-related harm.
“Alcohol has been confirmed as a group 1 carcinogen... there is no safe level of alcohol,” - Dr Pankaj Chaturvedi

This initiative reflects a growing recognition of the health risks associated with alcohol consumption and aims to reduce the incidence of alcohol-related cancers.

item.title: Dense fog engulfs Delhi; flight operations hit at IGI airport - The Hindu
item.description:
Dense Fog Disrupts Flight Operations in Delhi

Published: January 04, 2025 07:34 am IST

Source: The Hindu

Delhi has experienced the longest period of zero visibility due to intense fog, halting flight operations at Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGI) for several hours.

The key points regarding the fog disruption include:

  • Record zero visibility lasting 9 hours from January 3 to January 4.
  • Fifteen flights diverted between 12:15 am and 1:30 am on January 4.
  • IndiGo and Air India reported significant delays and held operations.
  • Over 400 flights were delayed on January 3 due to adverse weather conditions.
  • CTA III compliant airplanes are less affected.
“Passengers are requested to contact the airline concerned for updated flight information.” - Delhi International Airport Ltd (DIAL)

This weather event illustrates the challenges posed by fog to air travel, affecting hundreds of passengers and airlines over the course of several days.
